name: Eutierria - Demo
description:
Do you need a break? A need to feel some calmness, while going on an adventure? Then this is the game for you!

Relax and unwind in the magic world of Eutierria. Explore the world, dive into the deep ocean and explore the caves. Meanwhile, you have a mission. Eutierria needs your help. The magic in Eutierria is slowly fading away and making the peaceful world unstable, and there's only one way to fix it. Your mission is to find the ancient spell that will heal the world. On you way you have to get to know the world, its plants, and its creatures. And don't forget to take breaks sometimes.



Some background:

This game demo is the result of a design project with the purpose to explore how to design a video game, with the aim of reducing perceived stress, and encourage feelings of calm.  If only for a little while.

It is mainly based on research, theory,  playtesting and analysis of calming games. The information has been interpreted and then composed into what you can see today. 

What about the name Eutierria?

Eutierria is a term invented by the Australian sustainability professor Glenn Albrecht, and are described as:   “a good and positive feeling of oneness with the earth and its life forces.”.   Doesn't it sound lovely? Nature is a big stress reliever, even when it's pictured or just the sound of it, something that has been the base of the whole game. A feeling of nature when it's not in reach.

Before you play:
  • Headphones are recommended.
  • Before you start playing, remember to set the game to fullscreen.
  • Be sure you are in a calm place with no distractions.
  • Please be aware that the game is just a prototype, and only have a beginning. 
  • Take a deep breath, and have some relaxing fun!
